abstract: Obama administration is taking steps to fix two most common complaints about health plans under Affordable Care Act, one being inaccuracy of doctor directories and another regarding patients being blindsided with bills for costs that their insurance would not cover.
lead_paragraph: Health officials will require insurers to update doctor directories and hope to help patients estimate out-of-pocket costs.

headline.main: White House Moves to Fix 2 Key Consumer Complaints About Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: White House Moves to Fix 2 Key Consumer Complaints About Health Care Law

snippet: Health officials will require insurers to update doctor directories and hope to help patients estimate out-of-pocket costs.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
